citation.article-title: Sporolituus thermophilus gen. nov., sp. nov., a citrate-fermenting thermophilic anaerobic bacterium from geothermal waters of the Great Artesian Basin of Australia
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Sporolituus (Spo.ro.liâ€²tu.us. Gr. fem. n. spora a seed and, in biology, a spore; L. masc. n. lituus a curved rod, crook; N.L. masc. n. Sporolituus a spore-forming, curved rod).
Cells are strictly anaerobic, thermophilic, spore-forming, curved rods that stain Gram-negative.
16S rRNA gene sequence analysis indicates that the genus is a member of the family Veillonellaceae and most closely related to the genus Propionispora.
The type species is Sporolituus thermophilus.
